Alert Center

Township News

  1. Waterford Approved for $12.9 million Brownfield Tax Increment Financing

    March 26, 2019 - Today Waterford received approval of $12,864,514 in local and school tax capture to support a business development project that will demolish the vacant Summit Place Mall and construct a new business center in Waterford Township. Read on...

  2. Seeking Volunteers for Neighborhood Preservation Corps

    The Waterford Township Neighborhood Preservation Corps is gearing up for the 2019 season. Now seeking additional volunteers to help identify basic code violations in an effort to keep Waterford a great place to live, work and play. Read on...

  3. Annual Business Recognition Breakfast - Tickets on Sale now!

    Waterford Township and the Waterford Area Chamber of Commerce host this annual event to acknowledge longevity, commitment, community service, and beautification efforts of the Waterford business community. Friday, May 10, 2019 at 7:15am. Read on...

  4. Document Shredding April 23, 2019

    Document Shredding Sponsored by Margaret Birch, Treasurer Waterford residents only, please. Tuesday, April 23, 2019 from 10:00a.m. until Noon Town Hall parking lot 5200 Civic Center Dr. Waterford, MI 48329

  5. Attention Waterford Businesses

    Are you a Waterford business owner celebrating a milestone business anniversary 25+ years in 2019? Has your favorite Waterford business been serving the community for decades? Let us know! Read on...

  6. 2019 Outdoor Warning System Test Dates Announced

    Please be advised that Oakland County Homeland Security Division has published a list of dates they will be testing the outdoor warning siren system in 2019. Read on...
